meanings.definition: To make (something) totalitarian in character or nature.
meanings.sent1: The dictator wanted to totalitarianize the entire country, controlling every aspect of people's lives.
meanings.sent2: The government's attempt to totalitarianize the media was met with strong opposition from journalists.
meanings.sent3: The idea of totalitarianizing a small town for a reality TV show seemed absurd and unrealistic.
meanings.sent4: The company's strict dress code began to totalitarianize the office environment, stifling creativity.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to totalitarianize the once cheerful sky, casting a shadow over the city.

meanings.definition: To subject (a country, government, etc.) to a totalitarian regime.
meanings.sent1: The invading army sought to totalitarianize the peaceful nation, imposing strict rules and restrictions.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's rise to power led to efforts to totalitarianize the entire government, eliminating any opposition.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a group of toddlers trying to totalitarianize a daycare center for cookies was both amusing and adorable.
meanings.sent4: The new laws seemed to totalitarianize the country overnight, changing the way people lived their lives.
meanings.sent5: The oppressive regime's propaganda machine worked tirelessly to totalitarianize the minds of the citizens, shaping their beliefs.
